db:abstract.db:para: The QWebEngineProfile class provides a web engine profile shared by multiple pages.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A web engine profile contains settings, scripts, persistent cookie policy, and the list of visited links shared by all web engine pages that belong to the profile.

All pages that belong to the profile share a common QWebEngineSettings instance, which can be accessed with the settings() method. Likewise, the scripts() method provides access to a common QWebEngineScriptCollection instance.

Information about visited links is stored together with persistent cookies and other persistent data in a storage returned by storageName(). Persistent data is stored in a subdirectory set by calling setPersistentStoragePath(), and the cache is located in a subdirectory set by calling setCachePath(). The cache type can be set to in-memory or on-disk by calling setHttpCacheType(). If only the storage name is set, the subdirectories are created and named automatically. If you set any of the values manually, you should do it before creating any pages that belong to the profile.

The cache can be cleared of links by calling clearVisitedLinks() or clearAllVisitedLinks(). PersistentCookiesPolicy describes whether session and persistent cookies are saved to and restored from memory or disk.

Profiles can be used to isolate pages from each other. A typical use case is a dedicated off-the-record profile for a private browsing mode. Using QWebEngineProfile() without defining a storage name constructs a new off-the-record profile that leaves no record on the local machine, and has no persistent data or cache. The isOffTheRecord() method can be used to check whether a profile is off-the-record.
The default profile can be accessed by defaultProfile(). It is a built-in profile that all web pages not specifically created with another profile belong to.

Implementing the QWebEngineUrlRequestInterceptor interface and registering the interceptor on a profile by setUrlRequestInterceptor() enables intercepting, blocking, and modifying URL requests (QWebEngineUrlRequestInfo) before they reach the networking stack of Chromium.

A QWebEngineUrlSchemeHandler can be registered for a profile by installUrlSchemeHandler() to add support for custom URL schemes. Requests for the scheme are then issued to QWebEngineUrlSchemeHandler::requestStarted() as QWebEngineUrlRequestJob objects.

Spellchecking HTML form fields can be enabled per profile by using the setSpellCheckEnabled() method and the current languages used for spellchecking can be set by using the setSpellCheckLanguages() method.

db:section.db:title: enum QWebEngineProfile::HttpCacheType
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the HTTP cache type:

db:td.db:para: Use an in-memory cache. This is the default if off-the-record is set.
Use a disk cache. This is the default if the profile is not off-the-record. If set on an off-the-record profile will instead set MemoryHttpCache.
Disable both in-memory and disk caching. (Added in Qt 5.7)

db:section.db:title: enum QWebEngineProfile::PersistentCookiesPolicy
db:section.db:para: This enum describes policy for cookie persistency:

db:td.db:para: Both session and persistent cookies are stored in memory. This is the only setting possible if off-the-record is set or no persistent data path is available.
Cookies marked persistent are saved to and restored from disk, whereas session cookies are only stored to disk for crash recovery. This is the default setting.
Both session and persistent cookies are saved to and restored from disk.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QWebEngineProfile::QWebEngineProfile(QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new off-the-record profile with the parent parent.

An off-the-record profile leaves no record on the local machine, and has no persistent data or cache. Thus, the HTTP cache can only be in memory and the cookies can only be non-persistent. Trying to change these settings will have no effect.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QWebEngineProfile::QWebEngineProfile(const QString &storageName, QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new profile with the storage name storageName and parent parent.
The storage name must be unique.
A disk-based QWebEngineProfile should be destroyed on or before application exit, otherwise the cache and persistent data may not be fully flushed to disk.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebEngineProfile::cachePath() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the path used for caches.
By default, this is below StandardPaths::CacheLocation in a QtWebengine/StorageName specific subdirectory.

db:note.db:para: Use QStandardPaths::writableLocation(QStandardPaths::CacheLocation) to obtain the QStandardPaths::CacheLocation path.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::clearAllVisitedLinks()
db:section.db:para: Clears all links from the visited links database.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::clearHttpCache()
db:section.db:para: Removes the profile's cache entries.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::clearVisitedLinks(const QList<QUrl> &urls)
db:section.db:para: Clears the links in urls from the visited links database.

db:section.db:title: QWebEngineClientCertificateStore *QWebEngineProfile::clientCertificateStore()
db:section.db:para: Returns the profile's client certificate store.

db:section.db:title: QWebEngineCookieStore *QWebEngineProfile::cookieStore()
db:section.db:para: Returns the cookie store for this profile.

db:section.db:title: [static] QWebEngineProfile *QWebEngineProfile::defaultProfile()
db:section.db:para: Returns the default profile.
The default profile is off-the-record.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebEngineProfile::downloadPath() const
db:section.db:para: The path to the location where the downloaded files are stored.

db:note.db:para: By default, the download path is QStandardPaths::DownloadLocation.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::downloadRequested(QWebEngineDownloadRequest *download)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever a download has been triggered. The download argument holds the state of the download. The download has to be explicitly accepted with QWebEngineDownloadRequest::accept() or it will be cancelled by default. The download item is parented by the profile. If it is not accepted, it will be deleted immediately after the signal emission. This signal cannot be used with a queued connection.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebEngineProfile::httpAcceptLanguage() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the value of the Accept-Language HTTP request-header field.

db:section.db:title: int QWebEngineProfile::httpCacheMaximumSize() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the maximum size of the HTTP cache in bytes.
Will return 0 if the size is automatically controlled by QtWebEngine.

db:section.db:title: QWebEngineProfile::HttpCacheType QWebEngineProfile::httpCacheType() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of HTTP cache used.
If the profile is off-the-record, MemoryHttpCache is returned.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebEngineProfile::httpUserAgent() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the user-agent string sent with HTTP to identify the browser.

db:note.db:para: On Windows 8.1 and newer, the default user agent will always report "Windows NT 6.2" (Windows 8), unless the application does contain a manifest that declares newer Windows versions as supported.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::installUrlSchemeHandler(const QByteArray &scheme, QWebEngineUrlSchemeHandler *handler)
db:section.db:para: Registers a handler handler for custom URL scheme scheme in the profile.
It is necessary to first register the scheme with QWebEngineUrlScheme::registerScheme at application startup.

db:section.db:title: bool QWebEngineProfile::isOffTheRecord() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this is an off-the-record profile that leaves no record on the computer.
This will force cookies and HTTP cache to be in memory, but also force all other normally persistent data to be stored in memory.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.5] bool QWebEngineProfile::isPushServiceEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the push messaging service is enabled.

db:note.db:para: By default the push messaging service is disabled.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: bool QWebEngineProfile::isSpellCheckEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the spell checker is enabled; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QWebEngineProfile::PersistentCookiesPolicy QWebEngineProfile::persistentCookiesPolicy() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current policy for persistent cookies.
If the profile is off-the-record, NoPersistentCookies is returned.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebEngineProfile::persistentStoragePath() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the path used to store persistent data for the browser and web content.
Persistent data includes persistent cookies, HTML5 local storage, and visited links.
By default, this is below QStandardPaths::DataLocation in a QtWebengine/StorageName specific subdirectory.

db:note.db:para: Use QStandardPaths::writableLocation(QStandardPaths::DataLocation) to obtain the QStandardPaths::DataLocation path.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::removeAllUrlSchemeHandlers()
db:section.db:para: Removes all custom URL scheme handlers installed in the profile.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::removeUrlScheme(const QByteArray &scheme)
db:section.db:para: Removes the custom URL scheme scheme from the profile.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::removeUrlSchemeHandler(QWebEngineUrlSchemeHandler *handler)
db:section.db:para: Removes the custom URL scheme handler handler from the profile.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.2] void QWebEngineProfile::requestIconForIconURL(const QUrl &url, int desiredSizeInPixel, std::function<void (const QIcon &, const QUrl &)> iconAvailableCallback) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void requestIconForIconURL(const QUrl &url, int desiredSizeInPixel, std::function<void (const QIcon &, const QUrl &)> iconAvailableCallback) const

db:section.db:para: Requests an icon with the specified url from the database. Each profile has its own icon database and it is stored in the persistent storage thus the stored icons can be accessed without network connection too. The icon must be previously loaded to be stored in the database.

url specifies the URL of the icon. In case of more than one available icons the one with the size closest to desiredSizeInPixel will be returned. The result icon is resized to desiredSizeInPixel. If desiredSizeInPixel is 0 the largest available icon is returned.

This function is asynchronous and the result is returned by iconAvailableCallback. The callback is called if a request for an icon is performed. If the requested icon is available, the first parameter (with type QIcon) is the result. Otherwise, it is null.
The second parameter stores the URL of the requested icon. It is empty if the icon can't be fetched.

db:note.db:para: Icons can't be requested with an off-the-record profile.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.2] void QWebEngineProfile::requestIconForPageURL(const QUrl &url, int desiredSizeInPixel, std::function<void (const QIcon &, const QUrl &, const QUrl &)> iconAvailableCallback) const

db:methodparam.db:type: std::function<void (const QIcon &, const QUrl &, const QUrl &)>

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void requestIconForPageURL(const QUrl &url, int desiredSizeInPixel, std::function<void (const QIcon &, const QUrl &, const QUrl &)> iconAvailableCallback) const

db:section.db:para: Requests an icon for a previously loaded page with this profile from the database. Each profile has its own icon database and it is stored in the persistent storage thus the stored icons can be accessed without network connection too. The icon must be previously loaded to be stored in the database.

url specifies the URL of the page what the icon is requested for. In case of more than one available icons the one with the size closest to desiredSizeInPixel will be returned. The result icon is resized to desiredSizeInPixel. If desiredSizeInPixel is 0 the largest available icon is returned.

This function is asynchronous and the result is returned by iconAvailableCallback. The callback is called if a request for an icon is performed. If the requested icon is available, the first parameter (with type QIcon) is the result. Otherwise, it is null.
The second parameter stores the URL of the requested icon. It is empty if the icon can't be fetched.
The third parameter stores the URL of the page which the icon is assigned.

db:note.db:para: Icons can't be requested with an off-the-record profile.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: QWebEngineScriptCollection *QWebEngineProfile::scripts() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the collection of scripts that are injected into all pages that share this profile.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setCachePath(const QString &path)
db:section.db:para: Overrides the default path used for disk caches, setting it to path.
If set to the null string, the default path is restored.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setDownloadPath(const QString &path)
db:section.db:para: Overrides the default path used for download location, setting it to path.
If set to the null string, the default path is restored.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setHttpAcceptLanguage(const QString &httpAcceptLanguage)
db:section.db:para: Sets the value of the Accept-Language HTTP request-header field to httpAcceptLanguage.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setHttpCacheMaximumSize(int maxSize)
db:section.db:para: Sets the maximum size of the HTTP cache to maxSize bytes.
Setting it to 0 means the size will be controlled automatically by QtWebEngine.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setHttpCacheType(QWebEngineProfile::HttpCacheType httpCacheType)
db:section.db:para: Sets the HTTP cache type to httpCacheType.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setHttpUserAgent(const QString &userAgent)
db:section.db:para: Overrides the default user-agent string, setting it to userAgent.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setNotificationPresenter(std::function<void (std::unique_ptr<QWebEngineNotification>)> notificationPresenter)
db:section.db:para: Sets the function notificationPresenter as responsible for presenting sent notifications.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setPersistentCookiesPolicy(QWebEngineProfile::PersistentCookiesPolicy newPersistentCookiesPolicy)
db:section.db:para: Sets the policy for persistent cookies to newPersistentCookiesPolicy.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setPersistentStoragePath(const QString &path)
db:section.db:para: Overrides the default path used to store persistent web engine data.
If path is set to the null string, the default path is restored.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.5] void QWebEngineProfile::setPushServiceEnabled(bool enable)
db:section.db:para: Enables the push messaging service if enable is true, otherwise disables it.

db:note.db:para: Qt WebEngine uses Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) as a browser push service. Therefore, all push messages will go through the Google push service and its respective servers.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setSpellCheckEnabled(bool enable)
db:section.db:para: Enables spell checker if enable is true, otherwise disables it.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setSpellCheckLanguages(const QStringList &languages)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current list of languages for the spell checker. Each language should match the name of the .bdic dictionary. For example, the language en-US will load the en-US.bdic dictionary file.
See the Spellchecker feature documentation for how dictionary files are searched.
For more information about how to compile .bdic dictionaries, see the Spellchecker Example.

db:section.db:title: void QWebEngineProfile::setUrlRequestInterceptor(QWebEngineUrlRequestInterceptor *interceptor)
db:section.db:para: Registers a request interceptor singleton interceptor to intercept URL requests.
The profile does not take ownership of the pointer.

db:section.db:title: QWebEngineSettings *QWebEngineProfile::settings() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the default settings for all pages in this profile.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QWebEngineProfile::spellCheckLanguages() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of languages used by the spell checker.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebEngineProfile::storageName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the storage name for the profile.
The storage name is used to give each profile that uses the disk separate subdirectories for persistent data and cache.

db:section.db:title: const QWebEngineUrlSchemeHandler *QWebEngineProfile::urlSchemeHandler(const QByteArray &scheme) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the custom URL scheme handler register for the URL scheme scheme.

db:section.db:title: bool QWebEngineProfile::visitedLinksContainsUrl(const QUrl &url) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if url is considered a visited link by this profile.
